intro: Marlierea richardiana, commonly known as the Richard's marlierea, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and prefers partial shade. Its botanical features make it an attractive choice for ornamental gardening in warm climates.
